Rat Trap helps to bring Windlord to the CR chamber as Night Shift sticks ar=
ound to help with Nightlight.  He tries to re assure her with a gentile han=
d on her shoulder.

"It's all right Nightlight, you're safe, don't worry, w=
e're gonna do all we can ta help you out.  That's a promise."

Rat Trap thu=
mbs up.

"CR Chamber's ready for Windlord.   Okay buddy, when you wake up, =
you're gonna feel right at home."

Straight Shot knew she had to meet up wi=
th Kup quickly.  And she knew that she had no vehicle mode or air craft mod=
e to transform into.  Just her luck, she was not far from where Quickstride=
 was, as he was with Legacy and the others.  Quickstride lifts his head and=
 spots her.

" Guys, look, it's another Autobot.  She looks like she's wavi=
ng toward me.  Legacy, I'm gonna go see what she needs."

He canters up to =
Straight Shot and stops to offer his back. She smiles.

"I thought I recogn=
ized ya.  Quickstride, right?"

He nodds.

"That's me.  Hop on, where to?"
=

She hops onto his back, and grips his long, copper mane.

" I need ta get =
back ta the Ark, ta meet up with Kup, he has something Tucson needs and tha=
t I'm gonna bring to him."

He looks to her.

"Say no more we're there.  Ho=
ld on, my gait isn't exactly the smoothest."

She holds on as he bolts towa=
rd the Ark.

Meanwhile, Tucson Prime manages to get Talon's message.  He wa=
s happy to hear her voice.

" Strange day this is turning out to be isn't i=
t Talon?  I'll remain put so you can find me easilly.  Legacy has just loca=
ted me along with Perceptor.  I'm in one piece, but I'm not so sure about R=
odimus. I hope he's all right.  Anyway, I'll look forward to a little down =
time with you as soon as this is behind us."

He turns to Perceptor.  Again=
 more gears turn.

" Perceptor, I'd like to thank you for your help and you=
r willingness to return where you felt most intimidated.  To me, that is no=
t the way of a Predacon, but the valor of a Maximal.  And no, it's NOT an i=
nsult, it's a complement.  I'm sorry you have not had the experience of hav=
ing a formal complement, and I promise you what I say I mean.  Your help is=
 valuable and I can not put a price on it.  Speaking of your help...  Did -=
 you by chance create the shell program?  If so, perhaps you know of a way =
to reverse it.  Anything you can help us we'll gladly take, and we will pro=
tect you if need be, from Hydras."

Tucson Prime unlike Hydras, didn't need=
 the power of oppression to win his comrades, and he knew that he couldn't =
force anyone to do anything they didn't want to do.  And he always expected=
 himself to return the favors that are given to him. Perceptor's help was v=
aluable he knew he'd have quite a debt to pay to him once everything was sa=
id and done.  He holds out a hand to Perceptor.

" Legacy, please note that=
 from this day forth, although Perceptor is of a different faction, he has =
helped us greatly.  Therefore, we must always keep our doors open to him if=
 he needs our help and our protection.  Enemy or not, he has risked his own=
 spark to help us and that is something we must all honor.  Perceptor, I wo=
uld personaly like to shake your hand in a show of peace and Neutrality.  Y=
ou've earned my respect as a comrade and shown us selflessness and the abil=
ity to cooperate with the opposite faction.  The choice is yours Perceptor,=
 and I respect what you choose."



--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Preston =

 then all is lost."

ntrance making it very difficult to

 meeting violently somewhere much

of Tuscon very little can be discerned as the steam seems to

ike smoke, but up ahead what sounds like metal scraping on

eard as if something is being dragged, but quickly
